719913f.title: Manhattan: Front Street - Fulton Street
719913f.text:
205 Front Street, west side, between Fulton and Beekman Streets,
showing a building occupied bw Wm. P. Howell, a firm established in
1797.
About 1870 7
Gift of Edmund B. Childs
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
719913f.folder: Front Street & Fulton Street, Manhattan, NY

719937f-a.title: Manhattan: Fulton Street - Front Street
719937f-a.text:
Fulton Street, west from Front Street, showing a narrowing of
this thoroughfare at Water Street. Beyond same, on Pearl Street
appears the Fulton Street station of the South Ferry division of the
2nd and 3rd Ave. Elevated lines. In the background is the Woolworth
Building, overshadowing the twin spires of the Park Row Building.
October 1914.
Views 1,2
George L. Balgue.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
719937f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Front Street, Manhattan, NY

724244f-a.title: Manhattan: Water Street - Fulton Street
724244f-a.text:
Water Street, at the N.W. corner of Fulton Street. Also shown
is Fulton Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Water
Street.
About 1921.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

719936f-a.title: Manhattan: Fulton Street - Front Street
719936f-a.text:
Fulton Street, north side, west from Front (right) to Water
(left) Streets and showing at the N.W. corner of the two first
mentioned points a ventilator shaft of the Municipal Subway System.
To the right apnears a northward view on the west side of Front
Street, to Beekman Street.
September 13, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
NO RRPRODUCTIONS.

719941f-b.title: Manhattan: Fulton Street - Pearl Street
719941f-b.text:
Fulton Street, west from Pearl Street. This thoroughfare
makes a slight bend at Gold Street. The 12-story structure
there, No's. 81-5 Fulton Street, 57 Gold Street and 90 Ann Street,
housed the Market and Fulton office of the Irving Trust Co. in
1922.e It was demolished in 1930 and a 20-story annfx erected
to the adjoining Royal IInsurance Co. Building. This stage
appears in View 3.
View 1: 1906
George L. Balgue
MAY BE REPRODUCED
View 2: January 30, 1928
View 3: January 8, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODTCTIONS
aThis structure, erected in 1888, formerly housed the Market
and Fulton National Bank, an organixation that succeeded the
Market Bank (founded in 1852) and the Fulton Bank (organized
in 1824). These were consolidated on Docember 20, 1887 (Nation-
al charter dated 1864) and this new structure erected on the
aite of the Fulton Bank. Tho Market Bank in 1854 established
itself at Beekman and Pearl Streets removing here on the uni-
fication. On an upger floor is the Fulton Club.
719941f-b.folder: Fulton Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
